intro: Melananthus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, woody growth and small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Melananthus fasciculatus is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
